alert.note: Alert for Putnam (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 07 at 5:35PM CDT until June 07 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL PUTNAM COUNTY... At 535 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Cookeville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 529 PM...quarter size hail was reported in Cookeville near Jackson Street at Buffalo Valley Road. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cookeville and Algood. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 282 and 295. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
